back_cards.definition_en: Something that is difficult to understand or explain
back_cards.example_en: The detective tried to solve the mystery of the missing necklace.

back_cards.definition_en: A story or event with an unknown outcome
back_cards.example_en: She loves reading mystery novels on weekends.
The sudden disappearance of the bird was a mystery.

back_cards.definition_en: An element of secrecy or intrigue
back_cards.example_en: His quiet nature added a mystery to his personality.
The ancient ruins remain a mystery to historians.

back_cards.definition_en: A competition to determine a winner
back_cards.example_en: The team won the basketball championship last night.

back_cards.definition_en: The title of being a champion
back_cards.example_en: She earned the championship in figure skating.
The championship game drew a huge crowd.
He competed in the chess championship.

back_cards.definition_en: A prestigious award in a field
back_cards.example_en: The school celebrated its debate championship.

back_cards.definition_en: To set up or place equipment for use
back_cards.example_en: They will install a new air conditioner tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To put software on a device
back_cards.example_en: She needs to install the latest app update.

back_cards.definition_en: To establish someone in a position
back_cards.example_en: The committee will install the new president.

back_cards.definition_en: To fix or place something in position
back_cards.example_en: He helped install shelves in the garage.

back_cards.definition_en: To initiate a system or process
back_cards.example_en: The company will install new security measures.

back_cards.definition_en: A story, often fictional or imaginative
back_cards.example_en: She told a tale about a magical forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrative of real or fictional events
back_cards.example_en: His tale of adventure captivated the audience.
The village elder shared an old tale.
He shared a tale from his childhood.

back_cards.definition_en: A literary work with a moral
back_cards.example_en: The tale taught a lesson about honesty.
The statue represents liberty for all.
She values her liberty to make decisions.
Voting is a liberty in a democracy.
The colony fought for its liberty.
He enjoys the liberty of working remotely.
The cat hid beneath the table.

back_cards.definition_en: In a lower position or status
back_cards.example_en: She felt beneath her peers in confidence.
The treasure was buried beneath the sand.
Beneath his smile, he was upset.
The village lies beneath the mountain.

back_cards.definition_en: A person traveling in a vehicle
back_cards.example_en: The bus carried fifty passengers to the city.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone on a plane or train
back_cards.example_en: The passenger boarded the flight early.

back_cards.definition_en: A traveler in a public transport
back_cards.example_en: Passengers waited for the delayed train.

back_cards.definition_en: A person not driving or operating
back_cards.example_en: She was a passenger in her friend’s car.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a travel group
back_cards.example_en: The tour guide counted all the passengers.
The physician prescribed medicine for her cold.
He consulted a physician about his injury.

back_cards.definition_en: A specialist in a medical field
back_cards.example_en: The physician works in pediatric care.

back_cards.definition_en: A doctor in a hospital setting
back_cards.example_en: The physician examined the patient thoroughly.
She’s a skilled physician known for compassion.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who completed a degree
back_cards.example_en: She’s a recent college graduate.
The graduate received a diploma.
The company hired a graduate for the role.
He’s a graduate of a top university.
The graduate celebrated with her family.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a keen edge or point
back_cards.example_en: The sharp knife cut the bread easily.
Her sharp mind solved the puzzle fast.
He felt a sharp pain in his leg.
The photo has a sharp focus.
He looked sharp in his new suit.
The lab tested the substance for toxicity.

back_cards.definition_en: The essence or core of something
back_cards.example_en: Her argument lacked substance.
The substance was banned in sports.
His speech had substance and inspired many.
The substance stained the fabric permanently.
The atmosphere protects us from harmful rays.

back_cards.definition_en: The mood or vibe of a place
back_cards.example_en: The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere.

back_cards.definition_en: A layer of gases in science
back_cards.example_en: Scientists study the atmosphere’s composition.
The party had a lively atmosphere.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of ambiance or feel
back_cards.example_en: The concert created an electric atmosphere.

back_cards.definition_en: To mix something by moving it
back_cards.example_en: She will stir the soup to blend flavors.
The speech stirred the crowd’s emotions.
The movie stirred memories of her childhood.
He stirred the batter for the cake.
The wind stirred the leaves on the ground.

back_cards.definition_en: A follower of the Islamic faith
back_cards.example_en: The Muslim prayed at the mosque daily.

back_cards.definition_en: A person adhering to Islam’s teachings
back_cards.example_en: She’s a Muslim who observes Ramadan.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of the Islamic community
back_cards.example_en: The Muslim shared stories of his culture.
The Muslim family celebrated Eid together.

back_cards.definition_en: A believer in the Quran’s teachings
back_cards.example_en: He’s a Muslim dedicated to charity work.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of a written work
back_cards.example_en: She read a passage from the novel.

back_cards.definition_en: A path or corridor for movement
back_cards.example_en: The passage led to a hidden room.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of traveling or moving
back_cards.example_en: The ship’s passage across the ocean was smooth.
The passage of time healed her grief.

back_cards.definition_en: A segment of speech or text
back_cards.example_en: The teacher analyzed the passage in class.
She added pepper to the soup.
The recipe calls for red bell pepper.
He sprinkled black pepper on his eggs.

back_cards.definition_en: example Pepper gave the steak a bold taste.

back_cards.example_en: The garden grew chili peppers.
The teacher will emphasize the key points.
She emphasized the need for teamwork.
The speaker emphasized her argument with facts.

back_cards.definition_en: To focus attention on an idea
back_cards.example_en: He emphasized safety during the training.
The ad emphasizes the product’s quality.
The cable powers the entire building.
She plugged in the USB cable.

back_cards.definition_en: A bundle of wires for communication
back_cards.example_en: The internet relies on underwater cables.

back_cards.definition_en: A rope or chain for support
back_cards.example_en: The bridge is held by strong cables.

back_cards.definition_en: A service for TV or internet
back_cards.example_en: They subscribed to a cable package.

back_cards.definition_en: A shape with four equal sides
back_cards.example_en: The table is shaped like a square.

back_cards.definition_en: A public open area in a city
back_cards.example_en: The festival was held in the town square.

back_cards.definition_en: A mathematical term for a number
back_cards.example_en: The square of four is sixteen.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for measuring right angles
back_cards.example_en: The carpenter used a square for precision.
The room is ten square feet.
She followed a recipe for chocolate cake.

back_cards.definition_en: A guide for cooking a dish
back_cards.example_en: The recipe called for fresh herbs.
Hard work is the recipe for success.

back_cards.definition_en: A list of ingredients and steps
back_cards.example_en: He shared his grandmother’s recipe.

back_cards.definition_en: A culinary plan for a meal
back_cards.example_en: The recipe made a delicious soup.

back_cards.definition_en: A heavy or bulky thing carried
back_cards.example_en: The truck carried a load of bricks.

back_cards.definition_en: An amount of work or tasks
back_cards.example_en: She has a heavy load this semester.
The ship delivered a load of supplies.
The project was a load on his mind.
He put a load of laundry in the washer.

back_cards.definition_en: The top covering of a building
back_cards.example_en: The roof leaked during the storm.
They repaired the roof after the hurricane.

back_cards.definition_en: The upper part of a vehicle
back_cards.example_en: The car has a sunroof on its roof.
The barn’s roof was painted red.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for home or safety
back_cards.example_en: They provided a roof for the homeless.

back_cards.definition_en: Next to or at the side of
back_cards.example_en: She sat beside her friend at the concert.
The house is beside a quiet lake.
His skills are impressive beside others.
The shop is beside the bakery.
She stood beside him during the challenge.
She steamed carrots and other vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: An edible part of a plant
back_cards.example_en: The soup contains fresh vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: A food item in a healthy diet
back_cards.example_en: He eats vegetables with every meal.
The farm grows organic vegetables.
The recipe includes a mix of vegetables.
She worked hard to accomplish her goals.
He accomplished the project on time.

back_cards.definition_en: To fulfill a purpose or plan
back_cards.example_en: They hope to accomplish a new record.
The team accomplished the mission successfully.
She accomplished her dream of running a marathon.
The room was silent during the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: Not speaking or making a sound
back_cards.example_en: He remained silent during the meeting.
The forest was silent at dawn.
Her silent agreement was clear.
The silent night calmed everyone.
She has a habit of jogging every morning.
Reading before bed is his habit.
Biting her nails is a bad habit.
His habit of arriving late annoyed everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A customary way of doing things
back_cards.example_en: The family has a habit of eating together.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of finding something new
back_cards.example_en: The discovery of penicillin changed medicine.
Her discovery of a new species was exciting.

back_cards.definition_en: An uncovering of facts or truth
back_cards.example_en: The investigation led to a major discovery.
His discovery about the project surprised him.
The scientist’s discovery was published widely.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of healing or improving
back_cards.example_en: Her recovery from surgery was quick.
The recovery of the stolen car was a relief.
The economy is in recovery after the crisis.
His recovery from addiction inspired others.
Physical therapy aided her recovery.
The lab analyzed the DNA for evidence.
DNA determines many physical traits.
The police used DNA to identify the suspect.
Scientists study DNA to understand diseases.
Her DNA test revealed her ancestry.
The country defended its territory.
The forest is the bear’s territory.

back_cards.definition_en: An area of expertise or activity
back_cards.example_en: Marketing is her professional territory.
The team explored new territory in research.

back_cards.definition_en: A domain of influence or control
back_cards.example_en: The company expanded into new territory.
He took his girlfriend to the movies.
She’s my girlfriend from high school.
His girlfriend surprised him with a gift.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman in a dating context
back_cards.example_en: He met his girlfriend at a party.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of affection for a friend
back_cards.example_en: She called her best friend her girlfriend.

back_cards.definition_en: To be made up of parts
back_cards.example_en: The meal consists of rice and vegetables.
The team consists of five players.
The book consists of ten chapters.
Her diet consists mainly of fruits.
The project consists of several tasks.
She will surely pass the exam.
He’s surely the best candidate for the job.

back_cards.definition_en: To emphasize a belief or expectation
back_cards.example_en: Surely you can’t be serious about that.

back_cards.definition_en: In a definite or assured manner
back_cards.example_en: The plan will surely succeed.
Surely, we can find a solution together.
The receipt is proof of her purchase.
His success is proof of hard work.
The experiment provided proof of the theory.
She showed proof of her identity.
The photo was proof of their meeting.
She was nervous before her speech.
He felt nervous about the job interview.
His nervous laugh gave him away.
The injury affected her nervous function.
The nervous student fidgeted during the test.
The doctor gave immediate care to the patient.

back_cards.definition_en: Very close in time or space
back_cards.example_en: The immediate danger was avoided.
She demanded an immediate response.
The immediate area was evacuated.
Immediate action saved the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A space for leaving a vehicle
back_cards.example_en: She found parking near the store.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of stopping a car
back_cards.example_en: Parking in the city is always difficult.
The mall has a large parking lot.
The airport offers valet parking.
Handicap parking is near the entrance.

back_cards.definition_en: An immoral act against divine law
back_cards.example_en: He confessed his sin to the priest.
Lying is considered a sin in many faiths.
It’s a sin to waste so much food.
Greed is often seen as a sin.
The sermon focused on the concept of sin.
The unusual weather surprised everyone.
Her unusual choice of dress stood out.
An unusual bird visited the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: Strange or out of the norm
back_cards.example_en: His unusual behavior worried his friends.
The painting had an unusual color scheme.

back_cards.definition_en: A grain used as a staple food
back_cards.example_en: She cooked rice for dinner tonight.
The farmer harvests rice every season.
The dish includes rice and chicken.
He added rice to the soup.
Rice is a key part of their diet.

back_cards.definition_en: The application of science to design
back_cards.example_en: She studied engineering at university.
Engineering created the city’s bridges.
Software engineering is a growing industry.

back_cards.definition_en: The design of machines or structures
back_cards.example_en: Engineering solved the dam’s issues.
His engineering skills fixed the device.
The army will advance at dawn.
She worked to advance her career.

back_cards.definition_en: To provide money or resources early
back_cards.example_en: The bank will advance the loan.

back_cards.definition_en: To propose or suggest an idea
back_cards.example_en: He advanced a new plan for the team.
Technology continues to advance rapidly.
They will bury the time capsule tomorrow.
She buried her face in her hands.
The family will bury their loved one.
He tried to bury his feelings.
She buried herself in her studies.
She baked a chocolate cake for the party.
The wedding cake was beautifully decorated.
He bought a cake for his birthday.
The bakery sells cakes and cookies.
The cake had layers of cream and fruit.

back_cards.definition_en: Without a known name or identity
back_cards.example_en: The donor wished to remain anonymous.
An anonymous tip helped solve the case.
The city felt anonymous to the tourist.
The poem was written by an anonymous author.
She posted an anonymous comment online.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of fabric with symbols
back_cards.example_en: The flag waved proudly above the building.
The country’s flag was raised at the event.
The red flag warned of danger.
The team captured the flag in the game.
The referee waved a flag for the penalty.
She enjoys contemporary music and art.
The house has a contemporary design.
He studied contemporary events in history.
The gallery showcases contemporary artists.

back_cards.definition_en: Of the same period or era
back_cards.example_en: Her work is contemporary with his novels.
He was sent to jail for theft.
The suspect spent a night in jail.
The jail was overcrowded with inmates.
The town’s jail is near the courthouse.
She visited her brother in jail.
The rural village was peaceful and quiet.
Rural areas depend on crops for income.
He enjoys the rural lifestyle.
The rural school serves a small community.
The rural landscape was breathtaking.
